intro: Romulea bulbocodium var. dioica, commonly known as the mountain sandwort, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb characterized by its rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to rocky and arid environments, showcasing a robust root system for water storage. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is known for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils. Its unique morphology and habitat make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
